(2001).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":42}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5vc28","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8j67u","text":"Allen Institute for Brain Science 2023. Stereotaxic Injection by Nanoject Protocol. protocols.iohttps://dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.bp2l6nr7kgqe/v4Version created by Allen Institute","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":84,"length":12},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":171,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":96,"length":56},{"key":1,"offset":171,"length":15}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"AF4BE7D8A02C11EE87440A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.bp2l6nr7kgqe/v4"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"AF4BE7D8A02C11EE87440A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.protocols.io/researchers/allen-institute"}}}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step:
{"blocks":[{"key":"9n44b","text":"Using a standard mouse surgical suite (see references for example), 750nl of rAAV.EF1a.DIO.hChR2(H134R).eYFP or rAAV.EF1a.DIO.eYFP (3-4 x 10^12 vg/ml,
AAV5, University of North Carolina Vector Core; 1-2 x 10^13 vg/ml, AAV1,
Addgene, 27056-AAV1 and 20298-AAV1) were injected into each hemisphere of the
VTA of 3–4-month-old DAT-Cre mice.
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"708pb","text":"For each mouse, a dual optic fiber cannula (200/240 μm diameter, 6 mm length, 0.7 mm center-to-center FLT, 0.22 NA; Doric, DFC_200/240-0.22_6mm_DF0.7_FLT) was placed 200 μm above\nthe injection site and fixed to the skull. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"sp06","text":"For viral injections, the coordinates are AP - 3.52 mm, ML - +/- 0.35 mm, DV – 4.3\nmm. Injections were made at 0.2 Hz pulses. Each pulse injects 4.6 nl volume.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4mbtm","text":" Injected needles were kept in place in the injection site for ~15 minutes before withdrawal. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f7p8t","text":"Next, a 4-position receptacle connector (Harwin Inc., M52-5000445) was fixed anteriorly to the dual optic fiber cannula, with its posterior edge set at -0.6 mm.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"890st","text":" Skull implants are then fixed with dental cement. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"17epu","text":"A 4-position connector (Harwin Inc., M52-040023V0445) with pins removed from one end was used to cap the receptacle connector.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6sda2","text":"The conditions used for VTA injections and implants were as above, and 3–5-month-oldDAT-Cre males were used.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c7h24","text":"Additionally, 1 μl and 500 nl of AAV9-hSyn-GRAB-rDA1m (2 x 10^13 vg/ml; RRID:Addgene_140556) were injected into the dorsal striatum (AP 0.5 mm, ML +2.1 (right), DV 2.3 (from brain surface)) and ventral striatum (AP 1.15mm, ML +1.65 (right),DV 4.2 (from Bregma)), respectively.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2j250","text":"For photometry fiber implants, mono fiberoptic cannula were used (400/430 μm diameter, 4 mm length (dorsal striatum) and 6 mm length(ventral striatum), 0.37 NA, 1.25 diameter ferrule, flat; Doric, MFC_400/430-0.37_6mm_MF1.25_FLT (ventral striatum) and MFC_400/430-0.37_4mm_MF1.25_FLT","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"90hdr","text":"(dorsal striatum)). Implants were inserted at a 22 degrees angle.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"749bk","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

cases.title: For dorsal striatum implantation
cases.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"1mcqi","text":"For dorsal striatum implantation, the cannula entered the skull at AP 0.5 mm and ML 3.03 mm at 22-degree angle. The angled implant penetrated the brain from its surface for 1.92 mm.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

cases.title: For ventral striatum implantation
cases.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"71ebp","text":"For ventral striatum implantation, the cannula entered the skull at AP 2.85 mm at 22 degrees angle, ML 1.65 mm. The angled implant penetrated the brain from its surface for 4.25 mm.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Stereotaxic Injections and Implants
